most_active_tickets.title: Bug: Subscription is not showing up within the Application(cancelation + resubscription w/ a new plan)
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update.  stucks at loading
VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension
Showing very big markdown in copilot

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop Application Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various issues with the Pieces OS and Desktop Application, including LTM query failures on macOS after prolonged use, sidebar display problems and pro subscription recognition failures on Windows, and "Ensure core dependencies" step issues during installation on Linux.  Further investigation is needed to identify the root causes and solutions for each platform-specific problem.

related_issues.title: Bug: Subscription is not showing up within the Application(cancelation + resubscription w/ a new plan)
related_issues.text:
Bug: Subscription is not showing up within the Application(cancelation + resubscription w/ a new plan)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

So when I freshly install Pieces, the LTM works fine.

When I've had it running for a few weeks, and I want to query the LTM, the query takes forever, and returns nothing.

The same happens via the MCP.

I use my machine all day, so there's a lot of context going into the LTM. The only explanation I can come up with is that it's just getting too big. The Workstream is, however, updating fine.

Removing all my Pieces data gets the LTM working again, but then I end up with this situation later. This is the third time I've been through this loop. It's really frustrating, because when I actually need the LTM, it fails.

The Clear LTM Data button doesn't work, just returning to Try again, from All Data to even for just clearing an hour of data.

I haven't cleared the LTM (well, I've tried, but the Clear LTM Data button doesn't work) so we have a live broken environment to debug with. I'm more than happy to assist with debugging this - let me know what you need!

Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces Side Bar issues
related_issues.text: Pieces Side Bar issues ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. The screenshot below. After reviewing the errors on GitHub, the error log notes will not save to the pieces os or the desktop. The app for the browser is logged in. This comes to the second issue. I have upgraded my account to the pro version however, even though i am logged in on the same account, i am unable to use the pro settings. As you can see from the image, I am correctly logged in. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Ensure core dependencies; Retry Step
related_issues.text:
Ensure core dependencies; Retry Step
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

### Pieces OS, Desktop Application

* Operating System / Platform: Linux

* Pieces OS Version 4.3.1





After installation, the “Initialize Desktop App” step has run successfully. The “Ensure core dependencies” step displays the message “Retry Step”.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces fails to start or authenticate on Windows and Linux
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS and Desktop failing to start or authenticate after updates on Windows and Linux.  Symptoms include authentication errors, "Ensure Core Dependencies" message, and application hangs.  Troubleshooting steps include reinstalling, checking firewall, and reviewing logs.  Potential solutions involve clearing local data/configuration files or further investigation of Pieces OS service and dependencies.

related_issues.title: An error occurred in the authentication flow.
related_issues.text:
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hello,
I am receiving this message when attempting to sign-in to Pieces.

```
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
Authentication Error ID: 00000000000000000000000000000000
```

This is a new install. (.appinstaller files)
I have never used the software before.
I do not have a pieces account (yet).
Environment: Windows 11

Launched the authentication by clicking the Sign In button in the Desktop App (4.2.1)
The auth link opened Firefox and generated the error.

I tried the following:
Disabling all extensions in Firefox
Changing my default browser to Edge and re-launching using Edge.
Re-installing with the .exe files.
Reviewed the windows firewall config (Pieces added it itself)
Looked at the Pieces log file but did not see anything obvious enough that I could solve on my own. (See attached)

[log-06252025-copy.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/20907036/log-06252025-copy.txt)

Thank you for the help.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update.  stucks at loading
related_issues.text: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update. stucks at loading ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1.0 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. For over a month I have been unable to use **Pieces OS** or **Pieces Desktop**. The Pieces OS service stopped working (I assume after the last update), and since then the desktop app no longer starts properly. Whenever I try to launch, the `Pieces` process starts but never progresses further. In **Pieces Desktop** I only see the message: _Ensure Core Dependencies Retry Step_ I’ve seen another user reporting a similar issue, but my case seems different (I’m attaching logs below). Unfortunately, this is not the first time I’ve faced problems with Pieces.... I’ve already lost all my history/snippets about three times in the past (distinct bugs). This situation is quite frustrating. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Install/update to the latest version of Pieces OS on Windows 11. 2. Launch Pieces Desktop. 3. Observe that the app does not open and gets stuck with the “Ensure Core Dependencies” message. ### Expected Behavior Pieces OS should start normally and allow Pieces Desktop to connect and function. ### Actual Behavior - Pieces OS process starts but hangs. - Pieces Desktop shows “Ensure Core Dependencies – Retry Step”. - Reinstalling from scratch does not solve the issue. ### System Information - **OS**: Windows 11 - **Processor**: Intel x64-based - **Pieces OS**: 12.2.1.0 - **Pieces Desktop**: 4.34 ### Troubleshooting Attempted - Tried reinstalling Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop from scratch → issue persists. - I noticed a similar issue has been reported, but I’m not sure it is directly related to what I’m experiencing. - I suspect that completely deleting all local data/configuration files could be a final solution, but this would cause me to lose all my snippets/history (which has already happened before). I’d prefer to avoid this unless it’s confirmed as the only fix. ### Logs [Support logs.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22142467/Support.zip) ### Additional... If this issue is already being tracked, that’s fine. If not, I’ll attempt to wipe all Pieces data and retry, though I suspect some leftover files/data may be blocking the reinstall. Thanks in advance for your support! Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Failing to Start on Windows
common_issues.description: Users are reporting Pieces OS and Desktop App failing to start after updates on Windows.  Logs show "MissingPlatformDirectoryException(Unable to get application documents directory)" error.  Suggested solutions include checking data directory permissions, reinstalling, and as a last resort, deleting local Pieces data.

related_issues.title: An error occurred in the authentication flow.
related_issues.text:
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hello,
I am receiving this message when attempting to sign-in to Pieces.

```
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
Authentication Error ID: 00000000000000000000000000000000
```

This is a new install. (.appinstaller files)
I have never used the software before.
I do not have a pieces account (yet).
Environment: Windows 11

Launched the authentication by clicking the Sign In button in the Desktop App (4.2.1)
The auth link opened Firefox and generated the error.

I tried the following:
Disabling all extensions in Firefox
Changing my default browser to Edge and re-launching using Edge.
Re-installing with the .exe files.
Reviewed the windows firewall config (Pieces added it itself)
Looked at the Pieces log file but did not see anything obvious enough that I could solve on my own. (See attached)

[log-06252025-copy.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/20907036/log-06252025-copy.txt)

Thank you for the help.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Integrations Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS and its integrations with VS Code and web browsers. Problems include large markdown in Copilot responses, errors saving logs, login issues despite pro upgrade, and continuous VS Code extension installation requests.  Users have attempted reinstalling dependencies and logging in/out without success. Further investigation is needed to identify the root causes and solutions.

related_issues.title: Showing very big markdown in copilot
related_issues.text: Showing very big markdown in copilot ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1 When I am sending questions to the Pieces copilot and it should respond with a block of code or a command to use the first one is very big and making it hard to scroll down to see the rest of the response. Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. related_issues.title: Pieces Side Bar issues
related_issues.text: Pieces Side Bar issues ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I have upgraded my account to the pro version however, even though i am logged in on the same account, i am unable to use the pro settings. As you can see from the image, I am correctly logged in. related_issues.title: VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension
related_issues.text: VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension. I have installed the extension from VSC, installed all the dependencies multiple times and never able to sign in, never able to launch Pieces from within VSC. I have the desktop running and installed and initialised every time, it makes no difference. I have even added the extension to web browsers and both work flawlessly. See screen shot below. Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces plugin and extension installation issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty installing Pieces plugins and extensions across various IDEs (JetBrains, VS Code) and operating systems (macOS, Windows, Linux). Issues include plugin unavailability, continuous installation requests, and dependency errors.  Check plugin marketplace compatibility, ensure dependencies are met, and retry installation steps. Verify Pieces desktop app is initialized.

related_issues.text: VScode extension continuously requesting installation, never installs unable to load extension ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I have installed the extension from VSC, installed all the dependencies multiple times and never able to sign in, never able to launch Pieces from within VSC. I have the desktop running and installed and initialised every time, it makes no difference. I have even added the extension to web browsers and both work flawlessly. See screen shot below. related_issues.title: Ensure core dependencies; Retry Step
related_issues.text:
Ensure core dependencies; Retry Step
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

### Pieces OS, Desktop Application

* Operating System / Platform: Linux

* Pieces OS Version 4.3.1





After installation, the “Initialize Desktop App” step has run successfully. The “Ensure core dependencies” step displays the message “Retry Step”.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the "Pieces OS and Desktop Application Issues" as they impact core functionality across multiple operating systems.
Investigate the root cause of Pieces OS and Desktop App failing to start on Windows, focusing on the "MissingPlatformDirectoryException" error.
Address the authentication flow issues on Windows to ensure new users can access the platform.
Improve plugin and extension installation experience by addressing compatibility and dependency issues across different IDEs.
Optimize Copilot responses to handle large markdown outputs effectively.
